briefTitle: Radial Artery Versus Saphenous Vein Patency (RSVP) Study

armGroups.label: Saphenous vein
interventionNames: Procedure: Coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery

armGroups.label: Radial artery
interventionNames: Procedure: Coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* on waiting list for clinically-indicated myocardial revascularization surgery
* aged 40-70 years
* significant stenosis (â‰¥70%) in the circumflex territory as identified on preoperative angiograms
* negative Allen's test (defined as the return of palmar circulation within 5 seconds of releasing ulnar artery compression)
* willing to give written informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* poor left ventricular (LV) function (LV ejection fraction \<25%)
* severe diffuse peripheral vascular disease or bilateral varicose venous disease
* inability to comply with the angiographic follow-up at 3 months or/and 5 years

outcomeMeasures.title: Patency Rates
outcomeMeasures.description: Angiographic patency rates of radial artery and long saphenous vein grafts at follow-up angiography

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Diameter of the Study Graft (Saphenous Vein or Radial Artery)
outcomeMeasures.description: Diameter response of the study vessel (saphenous vein or radial artery graft) to acetylcholine, measured using quantitative coronary angiography from the coronary angiogram.

outcomeMeasures.title: Blood Flow Volume
outcomeMeasures.description: Graft flow response to acetylcholine, calculated from vessel diameter using quantitative coronary angiography, and velocity using an intragraft Doppler wire.
